Игра неимоверно бьет по эмоциям, Колумбия просто завораживает. Но это не то место, где хочется жить. Это то место, где хочется взять с собой Элизу и творить справедливость ради правды. После концовки наворачевается брутальная мужская слеза, это не правда, игра не может так быстро кончиться, хочется еще. И тут в игру врывается Burial at Sea...

Although I never typically get into games of a historical background, I was told by a friend to play this game. As it turned out, It was a game that sucked me in and kept me playing. I ended up getting engulfed in the historic beautiful scenery because my specifications exceeded what was needed to run the game. Based on prior knowledge, this Bioshock was somewhat different from the others. Elizabeth was one of the main reasons I decided to play this game. Reviews at the time rated her one of the top helpful Ai characters of the time. The game felt like a Disney movie at times, but then It ended up blowing my mind. The plot was engaging until the end, where it was completely warped. I was Mind@#$%ed at the end. (WTF)
shit game

This was a great game and a great story line, though it did only take me about 20hrs of casual gaming time to beat. I got it on a steam sale,  so the price talked me into grabbing it and im glad i did. Make sure to watch all the credits through to the ending. If its under 20$ I reccomend this game highly, but it was sadly much shorter than you would want. 

The music was done well and sounded great and visually the game looks fantastic and runs well 3840 x 2160. They did a really good job with Elizabeth and all the different ways she interacts with things throughout the game if you lead here to different spots. Makes her feel less of a bot and more of a real charecter. All in all one of the better stories i have played in a game, am on my second playthrough now on hard seeing how it looks on this new 4k monitor and it doesnt disappoint.   

*minor spoiler > There is a part in the game where you find a guitar and if you pick it up and play it you and Elizabeth will do   a rendtion of "Will the Circle Be Unbroken" Really loved that part, would have liked a chance to pick it up and "Try it one more time" to play the longer version that you see at the end of the credits, which are worth sitting through for that version if you want to see a little behind the scene cut.

Amazing story and characters, let down by the repetitive gameplay and limited amount of variations in guns. Definitely worth the buy for the story, easily one of the best games out there, and the two burial at sea dlc stories are some of the best dlc ive played, definitely some serious fan service to the fans of bioshock 1

The bioshock franchise breathed new life into story telling... infinite was able to take it another step futher by absorbing the player into it's universe. This game brought back the excitement of a title release similar to HL2, the DLC is fantastic! Which adds a completely different playing style than its core game, but succeeds in a very positive way. If you are looking for one of the most visualy stunning games, engrossed story telling, and down right fun.. then Bioshock Infinite is for you : )

Great game, has nothing to envy its predecessors. Graphically beautiful, it takes us to a different place than Rapture, but is is still a pleasure to admire all the little details. Storywise it is even stronger in a way in relation to the other Bioshocks, a bit more Deus Ex Machinas, but an incredibly powerful storyline. The moment you start to look up stuff of the wiki and want to learn the lore a bit better is when you really enter the world of the game. Bioshock infinite has, like its ancestors, managed that brilliantly.

La bella Elizabeth e stata caratterizzata con uno spessore sopra la media che esalta tutta la storia,e la stessa fà la sua parte con un fascino amplificato da questa nazione sopra le nuvole autoproclamatasi stato indipendente. La grafica a tratti stupefacente (la prima parte e da urlo) e a tratti sufficientemente realizzata.....

Good story, visuals, and combat mechanics.  Excellent voice acting, as is typical of the Bioshock games.  Can be a bit *too* cinematic at times, taking the player out of the game for cut-scenes.  Also by the end of the game the combat gets a bit repetitive.  

Short but entertaining game, definitely worth playing.

Главное, что выделяет BioShock Infinite на фоне большинства громких новинок последнего времени, — это удивительная цельность и единство всех элементов игры. Здесь нет ничего лишнего — ни «приклеенной» RPG-составляющей, ни надуманных сюжетных поворотов. Геймплей, сценарий, графика, музыка в синхронном звучании создают поистине потрясающую стимпанковскую атмосферу. Когда ты проходишь по солнечным улицам парящей над небесным сводом Колумбии, слышишь приятную музыку, раздающуюся из каждого радиоустройства, подбираешь всякую дребедень, а твои действия сопровождаются характерным «биошоковским» треском и хрустом, то понимаешь, что мир Infinite совершенно уникален, и одно лишь нахождение в нем становится настоящим праздником.

Дизайнеры уровней проделали, не побоюсь этого слова, грандиозную работу. Внешний облик Колумбии заставит трепетать сердца даже самых притязательных любителей графики. Локации разнообразны, декорации на протяжении всего прохождения постоянно меняются, каждый квадратный метр города полон каких-то мелких деталей. Хочется ходить по этому миру, заглядывая в каждый закоулок, слушая все диалоги случайных прохожих, просматривая наборы забавных картинок в каждом кинетоскопе.

Немаловажную роль в погружении в мир играют аудиозаписи, повсюду разбросанные жителями города и главными действующими лицами. Помимо всего прочего, они позволяют лучше понять местный сюжет, разговор о котором достоин отдельной статьи.

one of my favourite games of all time (largely because of the story!) you will be sitting in front of the screen for a while when it ends just trying to process what you just saw lol. gameplay is still bioshock although many believe it inferior to its predecessor it is still very good fun tossing fireballs and lightning bolts with one hand while blasting people in the face with a shotgun in the other hand! 

since ken levine decided to make indie games now, this is technically the last bioshock game so i highly recommend it to fps fans, sci-fi fans and anyone who enjoys something different.

You are Booker Dewitt, and you're tasked to retrieve a strange girl from a city in the sky called Columbia.  Within minutes of arriving you're faced with the reality that this trip is going to change you.  As you make your way through the city, you realize something is just, [i]off[/], and you're not going to get out of this without taking some lives.

Great graphics, great combat, very few glitches or bugs, and great pacing.

I made it through most of the game without boosting my health, only ever picking shield or salt for the special bonus items.  If you're good at FPSs, you'll probably have a similar experience.  I really didn't start using vigors actively until the last quarter of the game.  Your choices don't seem to matter as much as they did in the first couple Bioshock games, which was a little disapointing, but I can forgive it given the well written story that I took part in playing out.

This game should be called Bioshock Finite
2 weapon limit
uninspired weapon design (pistol, shotgun, machinegun, and stat tweaks for Vox Populi versions)
no secondary fire feature or different ammo types
equippable gear decided by RNG so you have to reload the game for the ones you want
no exploration
no stat specialization or unique builds
choices in game doesn't matter; bird or cage? throw ball at interracial couple? doesn't influence main story at all
Elizabeth throwing items at you detracts from need to explore and scavange
final boss is tower defense, even more anticlimatic than fighting the final boss in Bioshock
you don't get to fight Songbird, you fight a damage sponge ghost mid game whose only challenge is to infinitely respawn grunts instead

don't get this game, get System Shock 2 instead

So we were discussing what game we had as a reference, it was like "Majora's Mask", "Half-Life", etc. But then we realized these games are from the past, and when the question "can you mention a good storylined game that came out after 2005 ?" I couldn't answer. Nothing I knew came close to Half-Life, as cheesy as this game can get. 

tl;dr, I checked the highest-score games, bought the three bioshock, and now the only game I can think of when talking about a reference of our generation (I am 20) it is this one.

Fan of System Shock 2?  Stop reading and buy this now.

A beautiful cinematic story with adequate combat thrown in.  Elizabeth is a useful companion - she is invisible to the AI and when you run low on virtually anything she magically finds more.  A little gamey, but better than a retarded escort mission where you fail because she gets stuck behind a barrel.

The ending took me by surprise and it's only one of two games that I had to stop and digest what I just watched.

Bonus: The skyhook makes you feel like Errol Flynn, swashbuckling out of the heavens and delivering pain to your enemies.

In fact, stop reading and just buy Bioshock Infinite right now.
A very intence and mind bending game. I recommend the game to all.

I have been a fan of the bioshock series since I first played the first Bioshock, now in this game the focus is taken to another mysterious city, this time in the sky. You play as Booker Dewitt with a shady past and a gambling problem, you are sent to the city of Columbia to save Elizabeth, a strange girl with stranger powers. Your mission is to bring her to New York and the collectors will wipe away the debt. However like any Bioshock game, there is far more to the story than what it seems.

Great game and very powerful topics addressed. As a diehard fan of this series, I might be a little overcritical of it, with the knowledge that content was cut to make release, but that doesn't stop the content that is presented from being incredibly compelling. For people wondering if they should play this game that have played (and liked) the previous bioshock games, I would unquestioningly reccommend this game, but if previous installments hadn't yet been played, I'd first reccommend Bioshock 1, as a grand start, and 2 and Infinite in equal footing afterward. And if they were still ravenous for more, and didn't mind dated graphics (or had the computer knowhow to convene with the modding community and make use of new models), System Shock 2 is (at least in my nostalgic mind) the high point in the series. But the step down from its heights to Bioshock Infinite are so minute that I am merely knitpicking, now. Go for gusto and see for yourself!
